hadiths.english_translation: Narrated by Ibn Abbas regarding the verse: 'And there is not one of you but will come to it' - he said: None remains except those who enter it. Then: 'We shall save those who kept their duty and shall leave the wrongdoers therein on their knees'. He said: I saw the righteous saying: O Allah, save us from Hellfire safe and secure Muslims.

chainIssues: Chain includes Jabir al-Ju'fi who is classified as Da'if (Weak) by scholars
Transmission through weak narrator significantly affects chain reliability
Multiple indirect transmission terms in the chain

potential_issues.issue: Jabir al-Ju'fi (narrator ID 2075) is classified as Da'if (Weak) by hadith scholars
potential_issues.impact: This weakens the entire chain despite reaching back to Companion Ibn Abbas; Jabir was known to be unreliable in reporting

potential_issues.issue: Multiple indirect transmission terms ('an) in the chain
potential_issues.impact: Creates ambiguity about the directness of transmission between narrators

Topics: Quranic exegesis of Surah Maryam verses 71-72
Explanation of who enters Hell on the Day of Judgment
Islamic doctrine concerning salvation and punishment in the afterlife
Supplication of the righteous for deliverance from Hellfire
